Class Superblock

  • java.lang.Object
    • Superblock

  • public class Superblock
extends java.lang.Object
    This class reads the data of an ext2 filesystem's SuperBlock
    Author:
    Petros Soutzis, 2017-19

    • Method Detail

      • read

        private void read()
        This method will readBytes all the data that is contained in the Superblock, from the buffer in which the byte array was parsed

      • getInodeSize

        int getInodeSize()
        Returns:
        The total size of each Inode

      • getInodeCount

        int getInodeCount()
        Returns:
        The total number of inodes in filesystem

      • getInodesPerGroup

        int getInodesPerGroup()
        Returns:
        The total number of inodes in every block group

        int getBlockCount()
        Returns:
        The total number of blocks in filesystem

      • getBlocksPerGroup

        int getBlocksPerGroup()
        Returns:
        The total number of blocks in every block group

      • getVolumeName

        java.lang.String getVolumeName()
        Returns:
        The disk's name

      • getBlockGroupCount

        int getBlockGroupCount(int num_of_blocks,
                       int blocks_per_group)
        Parameters:
        num_of_blocks - the total number of blocks in the filesystem
        blocks_per_group - the total number of blocks in every block group
        Returns:
        The total number of block groups that the volume has
